text: 'This place has got a nice variety of bubble teas. You can also adjust the level of sugar in your drink and they actually make it accordingly'

author: Ivanna Kaleniuk
text: 'If you are a bubble tea fan definitely check out this place. Great variety of flavors and quick service. You can also order pick up 👍🏻'

author: prshant batra
text: 'I was told to wait since they seemed to be busy to order. I sincerely waited 10 mins and then a Chinese man walks in and orders. I was told by the lady behind the counter “I thought you are just here to see how bubble teas made since you don’t look Chinese or Asian”. Fact check - India is part of Asia and I found it to be super rude. Would never go there again.'

text: 'Very delicious!! Kind staff and fast service. There is so many options. I recommend kung fu milk tea.'

author: Umm Kalthum
text: 'Sadly BAD first experience:( green tea had a really bad after taste maybe bad??? When we asked if they would replace with something else was told flat out NO. Not my idea of good customer service! Not going back and do not recommend:( Hoboken)'

author: Logan Minami
text: 'I Came here on a whim before dinner after just seeing it on maps. Best bubble tea I’ve ever had.   I’m no tea connoisseur but I’ve spent 2 years working in a bubble tea shop and I’m from an area where bubble tea is very mainstream at every corner so I’ve had a good taste of many different kinds.\nThe tea itself was extremely “rich” and tongue tingling
column5: and the flavor I got was a very nice combo of strawberry lemon green tea.  Not to mention the grape popping bubbles was something I have never heard of but was very impressed by.  Would 100% recommend to anyone in the are or walking the streets.  Definitely will make that a must stop for now on whenever I’m up north!'

author: Akash Sharma
text: 'My favorite!'

author: Timothy Maryanski
text: 'Amazing service by girl with blonde hair behind the counter!!'

author: Liezel Ayangco
text: 'Very delicious!! Highly recommend the taro milk tea and wintermelon milk tea.'

author: Pete
text: "Would give five stars if you dialled down the sugar levels a little. It's getting to be too much
column5: even if you ask for less sugar."

text: 'Delicious bubble tea!'

author: Alex García
text: "I give it a 5 stars because their bubble teas are the best
column5: especially the mango slush. It's the best bubble I have ever tried. I'm currently disappointed with them because they are not giving stamp cards anymore (they are doing so well
column6: I don't understand why they take them out) but overall their bubble teas are good and prices I believe are fair. Their staff is friendly
column7: and the place is organized and clean."

text: 'Tea experience is too sweet.'

text: 'Terrible customer service! I ordered hot oolong tea
column5:
they made just black regular tea and refused in refund.

They asked me to pay when I wanted to exchange that drink for something else.

Manager was there but didn’t want to talk.
Rip off'

author: Agentsmith 2099
text: "They're awesomesauce!! Prices are pretty good but remember you get what you pay for! The staff is very friendly and very organized. Too bad you can't eat in yet because it is a very chill vibe. Their teas are great and their milk shakes or slushes are the best!! There spill proof cups are awesome in function and design! Whether it's a bubble tea or a milk shake that's the place to go👌"

author: Dakota Van Deursen
text: 'Fast
column5: personal
column6: and a great atmosphere. I stopped in at least once a day for almost five years. The staff took the time to get to know me (and prepare my drink before I ordered) despite the tons of people flowing through every day. This location set the gold standard in bubble teas
column8: despite the other tempting options all around.'

the tea is delicious and the precise ones are good.

author: kelsey M
text: 'Follow the freaking instructions guys!!!!!! I HATE jelly in my bubble tea. I specifically selected tapioca bubbles.\n\nWhy the HELL would you give me both tapiocas and stupid jelly. Guys instructions are so simple. Just pay attention. You ruined my drink and now I lost $12 of bubble tea
column5: grubhub service fee and tip.'

text: 'Great bubble tea!'

text: 'not to plesant'

author: Greedy V2
text: 'Love it process are good'

author: Bayane Khelili
text: 'I really hate to be the person to complain but it’s things like this that make me never want to return to stores. I’ve been a customer for years always place pick up orders without a problem
column5: even if they’re about to close soon I always get accommodated. Today I called at 9:40 to place my regular order that I get weekly and after the phone wasn’t answered multiple times knowing they’re open
column6: the girl answered but is hesitating to take my order saying we close at 10 are you gonna be here before then ? Like obviously that’s why I’m calling. After I drive all the way from jersey city and inconvenience myself
column7: I go inside to pick up my order that was placed 20 minutes ago and she tells me sorry I forgot. I’m like okay no problem
column8: I give her the order again and she tells me that they just dumped the bubbles. Honestly so irritating because I don’t want bubble tea without bubbles and I just drove there for no reason when I called. Get more reliable workers.'

author: Gabriela Espana
text: 'Best bubble tea'

author: anthony mauceri
text: 'Personally I prefer Gong Cha tea better but Kung Fu Tea is a much better option when socializing with friends due to the extra space and layout of the rooms.'

author: Emily Raque
text: 'A place to fulfill all your bubble tea needs'

author: Kavy Jain
text: 'Amazing bubble tea. If you are a fan of bubble tea and have acquired taste for

text: "I only visited once. Tapioca bubbles in the tea weren't fresh. Its texture was hard."

author: Karen N
text: 'They messed up on my order initially but staff were good about quickly fixing it. Apple Pay is accepted with no minimum. The tea is brewed perfectly. Hoping to see more bubble tea shops pop up in Hoboken - for now
column5: Kung Fu Tea is definitely #1.'

author: Mohibba Fatima
text: 'Best bubble tea ever.'

author: DeusCurrentMachina O.
text: "They always make the best bubble tea in comparison to other Hoboken locations. They have a great variety too.\nI'm all over New Jersey looking for good bubble tea. Lol"

author: Sally Elias
text: "There are so many flavors to choose from that I always try to pick a new one Every time I come. You can adjust how much sugar and ice you want which is a big plus for me. The tea flavor actually comes through and it's not overshadowed by too much sugar."

author: Zuhal Taş
text: 'I had my first bubble tea here and i loved it so i keep coming back here again and again. The lady at the register is very kind and friendly.  I tried kung fu tea and latte with bubbles. Both were really good but i think bubbles go better with the tea 👍😊'

author: Caleb Ward
text: 'One of the best boba tea places you can find in Hoboken! The building is decorated very nicely and makes the experience a lot better. Very fun and relaxing place to go with friends and family. They offer some board
column5: and card games to play while you wait for your drink
column6: or while you finish them. The service is usually fast and the quality is awesome!'

author: CC Mizrahi
text: 'Fantastic service and delicious tea'

author: Juli Sams
text: 'Fantastic coffee to get me going all day long! This place is a must stop whenever I come to NJ. Pro tip: go early!'

text: "Milk tea was good. Don't bother with the rice roll. The chicken was dry."

author: Jon Dow
text: 'Location claims their milk is dairy free... it is not.\n\nTheir milk is lactose free
column5: not dairy free.\n\nEdit: For the owner: The fine print of your menu online states that your milk powder contains “sodium caseinate”. This is milk protein and is dangerous for people with dairy allergy.'

text: 'I ordered yogurt orange and it was tasty.  Downside is that I was expecting a yogurt like semisolid food but in reality it is just like any other watered down orange juice.'

text: 'Friendly service

column6: I think. Very much like the free game station with retro arcade games that you can button mash on while waiting.'

text: 'Definitely try the Mango Snow if you visit. One of the best bubble tea!'

author: Lan
text: "As with any other Kung Fu tea the drinks are dangerously delicious.\n\nThis particular location
column5: however
column6: is definitely a 'get your drink and leave' kind of place
column7: and not a place to sit and chill at.. unless you get the one table that's in the back. The place is entirely too narrow and if you're seated by the wall people will brush up against you just by existing"

text: "Love the Buble Teas here. Only issue is not finding easy parking on Washington Street. That's more of a Hoboken problem though."

author: Jonathan Vick
text: 'Second time my order was not delivered correctly.  Mango slush with bubbles - converted into mango ice chunks with few bubbles
column5: jellies (nearly to the top of the cup)

author: James Fong
text: 'God bless'

text: 'Fast friendly service and such amazing selections of teas

author: Sandra “Sandi” Bartlett
text: 'Fun atmosphere with games available to entertain. Very small area and super loud on a constant basis.'

author: Gillibee
text: 'Best bubble tea. Bubbles are chewy but never hard and the herbal jelly is top notch.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: "I'm not that into bubble tea and these sort of drinks but my boyfriend really likes this place
column5: so I gave it a try. I can't remember if I've been to other Kung Fu Tea chains in the city or if they're all the same
column6: but I liked the menu system at this location. It's extremely customizable - you get to choose bubbles vs. tapioca
column10: and ice level. Just be careful thought because those add-ins can add up real quick. I had the iced oolong tea with herbal jelly. I really enjoyed it but lots of the herbal jelly chunks were way to big to fit through the straw. The tea was great too. It wasn't watered down like I was half expecting. Would definitely be willing to come back and try some other combinations."

author: Dalid Castillo
text: 'This place is so clean and a place you can chill with your friends and their bubble teas are just YUMMY!'

author: Carin Whitaker
text: 'Kung Fu is a franchise and they are popping up all over for good reason! Their bubble tea is the best I have had.  You can get it unsweetened
column5: half sweet
column8: double bubbles or jelly etc.  Everything is to order and I get the coconut milk tea
column11: and lught ice and whether I order it in Columbus Ohio or Hoboken NO it is the same amazing product.  Nailed it Kung Fu franchise gurus!! #bubbletea #kungfutea'

author: Alyssa Russek
text: 'The best service and delicious bubble tea'

author: Meng Chen Lee
text: 'Perfect place to grab a drink after school. Love the environment.'

text: 'I did not wait on line at all while ordering my tea. I waited 15 min for 1 tea that i did not get. I watched ppl get their tea n i did not. After  15 i just asked  for my money back. Ill never go there again.'
